result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael C Grier Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery by Prisoners, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.20(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Pay mandatory DNA surcharge, pay all court costs, fees and surcharges; failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment being entered. 25% of prison funds, collected by Department of Corrections, to go toward all monetary obligations.

***ORDER AMENDING JOC; It is ordered that the joc shall be amended to reflect a total of 130 days of sentence credit on count 1.***
Concurrent with: to 13CF5738

superMiscConds.notes: Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms.
No contact with victim, David S.

Cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the State of Wisconsin department of corrections, including Court ordered Mental Health Unit Supervision.
Provide DNA sample.
Pay restitution in the amount of ZERO.
Court advised defendant on Extended Confinement or "bad time".

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael C Grier Jr

records.addlTxt: Original SENTENCING HEARING Transcript ( 22 pages) commencing  07/01/2014 received and filed.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Order Amending Judgment of Conviction signed and filed.  Copies to the District Attorney's Office and Dept of Corrections.
Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this motion/request is hereby assigned to the Hon. Timothy M. Witkowiak, Br. 22, for review.  jbs
Letter from DOC seeking review of possibly excessive sentence credit.

Defendant Michael C Grier in court with attorney Matt Last.  Defendant Michael C. Grier in custody.  MIchael Lonski appeared for the STate of Wisconsin.  Initial Appearance was not completed due to raising of competency of defendant in this matter.  Parties agree and stipulate that Defendant was previously given a copy of the complaint, that he was previously advised of maximum penalties and right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court previously reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings, and Preliminary Hearing was waived on 3/28/14.  Initial Hearing Nunc Pro Tunc to 5/21/14.
Ineligible Voting Notice And Acknowledgement, FILED.
Of Right To Seek Postconviction Relief, FILED.
FILED.
FILED.

Defendant Michael C Grier in court with attorney Matt E Last.  Defendant Michael C Grier in custody.  Michael Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms. Defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  PSI was NOT ordered. Case set for sentencing in Branch 22.

  Sentencing hearing scheduled for 07-01-2014 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Matt Last appears before Madam Clerk Brenda, and ADA Michael Lonski appears by telephone.  Resolution pending in 14CF804 and 13CF5738.  
BOTH FILES HELD IN COURTROOM PENDING POSSIBLE RESOLUTION ON 05-21-2014 DURING JURY TRIAL IN 13CF5738.
Defendant's, FILED.
Defendant's Proposed, FILED.

Defendant Michael C Grier in court with attorney Matt E Last.  Defendant Michael C Grier in custody.  Michael Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant presents, and withdraws, motion for withdrawal of counsel.  SPEEDY Jury Trial, previously scheduled fo r06-02-2014, remains on Court's Calendar.

Attorney Matt E Last in court, defendant Michael C Grier not in court, in custody.  Michael Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND ORALLY FILED with the Court.
Final Pretrial scheduled for 05-19-2014 at 08:30am and  Jury trial scheduled for 06-02-2014 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Michael C Grier in court with attorney Matt Last.  Defendant Michael C Grier in custody.  Michael Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 5, 2014 at 08:30 am.
With TURNOVER to Justice Point for monitoring.

Defendant Michael C Grier in court with attorney Matt Last.  Defendant Michael C Grier in custody.  Janet C. Protasiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin on behalf of Michael Lonski  

Doctor's report received and filed.  Parties reviewed report and do not contest findings.  Court found defendant competent to proceed and reinstated proceedings.  Arguments heard as to bail.  $2,500.00 CASH BAIL SET with TURNOVER to JUSTICE POINT for monitoring.  Preliminary Court contacted for Preliminary Hearing date.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for 03-28-2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Michael C Grier in court with attorney Darryl E Smith.  Defendant Michael C Grier in custody.  Janet Claire Protasiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Court is advised by the defense there is reason to believe the defendant is not competent to proceed.  Pursuant to Sec. 971.14 (2) Wisconsin Statutes, Court found probable cause, suspended proceedings and ordered defendant examined by the Forensic Unit.  Order for Examination, signed and filed.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.   Court ordered defendant REMANDED into custody of Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for March 20, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
